subject: Ethics
title: Carbon Offset Controversies
description: A 60-second lesson on Carbon Offset Controversies.

hook.text: An airline lets you pay $5 to 'offset' your flight. The forest they promise to plant may never grow.

buildup.text: Carbon offsets let polluters pay to fund green projects elsewhere instead of cutting their own emissions.

discovery.text: The idea is sound in theory: one ton emitted here, one ton absorbed there. Net result: zero.

twist.text: A 2023 investigation found over 90% of rainforest offsets by a major certifier were worthless.

climax.text: Offsets can delay real change by letting companies claim climate action while emissions keep rising.

punchline.text: Paying someone else to diet doesn't make you thinner.

quiz.question: What is the main ethical criticism of carbon offsets?
options: They are too expensive for most companies to afford
They always work perfectly but are unfairly criticized
They can delay real emission reductions while giving a false sense of climate action
